calibration.javaAplAlert: The Java applet viewer does not support Area Zoom.
calibration.selPlaAlert: You need to select a specific place in the image before you start the calibration.
calibration.instrTxt:
In the Live View window, Area Zoom allows you to use a mouse to zoom in on an area by drawing a rectangle in the image. To zoom in, click in the image, hold down the left button and drag the mouse cursor to draw a rectangle around the desired area. Release the mouse button and the camera will zoom in.

Calibration allows you to set the near and far zoom limits for Area Zoom.
calibration.instr1Txt: Using the zoom bar, zoom in on an object that can easily be identified close up and at a distance. The object should not be in the center of the image.
calibration.instr4Txt: Zoom out as far as possible and click on the object again.

ptz.nextBtnStatTxt: Go to next step i wizard
ptz.gkSetupGkGeneralTxt: Gatekeeper monitors an area and will zoom in, on for instance a license plate, if there is a movement in the area. Afterwards the camera will zoom out to the home position. To set up your gatekeeper you need to perform three steps.
ptz.gkSetupGkBull1Txt: Set up the two preset positions, the camera's home position and the zoomed in position.
ptz.gkSetupGkBull2Txt: Set up in which area movement should occur to trigger the Gatekeeper.
ptz.gkSetupGkBull3Txt: Set up the gatekeeper action rule.
ptz.gkSetupGkOutroTxt: This page provides the tools for creating and saving Preset positions.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull1Txt1: Using the pan, tilt and zoom controls to move the camera view to the required position.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull1Txt2: Using the pan and zoom controls to move the camera view to the required position.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull1Txt3: Using the tilt and zoom controls to move the camera view to the required position.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull1Txt4: Using the zoom controls to set the prefered zoom position.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull1Txt: Using the pan, tilt and zoom controls to move the camera view to the required position.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull2Txt: When satisfied with the camera view, enter a descriptive name for the position in the Current position field.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull3Txt:
If it is the home position, check the box Use current position as Home.
Checking this box will save this preset as the Home position. The position's name will in the lower drop-down have (H) added to the end of it.
ptz.gkCreatePrePoBull4Txt:
Click Add. This camera position is then saved as a preset position in the camera.
The position can be assumed at any time, by selecting it from the drop-down list of available positions.
ptz.gkDeletePrePoGeneralTxt: From the Available positions drop-down list, select the preset name to be deleted. Click Remove.
ptz.maxZooNoteTxt: Note: Increasing the max zoom rate will decrease the maximum possible resolution.
ptz.focusingWindowTxt: To focus on a preferred area of the camera's image, place the mouse pointer on the part of the image that you want to focus on, drag to create a rectangle around it and release the mouse. The camera will automatically adjust the image focus.

ptzQueue.hlpTxt: Click here for help on this page

ptzSettings_frame.returnHomeAlert1: When locking Digital PTZ, the camera will return to its home position when restarted.
ptzSettings_frame.returnHomeAlert2_1: It is therefore recommended to set current position as home position.
ptzSettings_frame.reConfigUnitResText: Reconfiguring. Please wait for the page to reload.

set_ptz_mode.infoTxt: This camera has the possibility to use either digital PTZ or an uploadable PTZ driver (used when the camera is mounted on a pan/tilt head). Select the appropriate PTZ method for this camera. Digital PTZ is the default and should be selected whenever a pan/tilt/zoom head is not used.
set_ptz_mode.modeOptZoomInstTxtTxt: Select this mode to use the optical zoom only at installation (i.e. remote zoom and focus). In this mode, optical zoom is disabled for monitoring. View areas and digital PTZ can be enabled for monitoring.
set_ptz_mode.modeOptZoomMonTxtTxt: Select this mode to use the optical zoom for monitoring (e.g. for Gatekeeper). In this mode, digital PTZ and view areas are disabled.
